p: Several diarylureas were described in the literature for their activities on CNS. Compound 52 ( Table 4) was effective as antiepileptic in both maximal electroshock (MES) and subcutaneous pentylenetetrazole (scPTZ) seizure tests, showing ED 50 value of 28.5 mg/kg against MES induced seizures. Toxicological results revealed that no significant toxicity was detected after administration for 14 days (sub-acute toxicity study) in rats. It also exerted antidepressant activity in forced swim test (FST) and tail suspension test (TST) in mice [ 99].
